prompt: Facts: Incident Date: 14.06.1979, evening.; Location: Village Madaiya Mahajanan, P.S. Ram Nagar, District Bareilly, Uttar Pradesh.; Parties: Accused - Pappu @ Tasavvur Husain, Munna @ Muzzamil Husain, Sharif @ Mohd. Sharif, Salim. Victim (Deceased) - Raj Kumar. Victim (Injured) - Om Prakash (PW-1).; Allegation: Dispute over irrigation water channel ('gool'). Pappu allegedly fired a country-made pistol hitting Raj Kumar in the chest, causing fatal injuries. Munna allegedly fired, hitting Om Prakash (PW-1) causing injuries. Sharif and Salim were allegedly present with lathis.; FIR: Lodged by injured eyewitness Om Prakash (PW-1) on 14.06.1979 at 9:30 PM at P.S. Ram Nagar.; Investigation: Site plan prepared, blood-stained earth collected, inquest conducted, bodies sent for post-mortem.; Medical Evidence: Post-mortem on Raj Kumar confirmed gunshot wound as cause of death. Injury report of Om Prakash (PW-1) noted gunshot injuries.; Key Witnesses: PW-1 (Om Prakash - injured eyewitness), PW-2 (Dal Chand - eyewitness), PW-3 (Yad Ram - eyewitness).; Trial Court Verdict: Convicted Pappu under Section 302 IPC (Life Imprisonment) and Section 307 IPC (7 years RI). Acquitted Munna, Sharif, and Salim.; High Court Verdict: Allowed Pappu's appeal, acquitting him of both charges. Grounds for acquittal included discrepancies in eyewitness testimonies (regarding source of light, sequence of shots, witness locations), delay in FIR reaching the Magistrate, and perceived insufficiency of motive.; Supreme Court Appeal: Filed by the State of Uttar Pradesh challenging the High Court's acquittal of Pappu. | IPC: Section 302 (Murder), Section 307 (Attempt to Murder), Section 34 (Acts done by several persons in furtherance of common intention - Basis for initial charges against all four, though ultimately Pappu convicted for individual acts)
